derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English queristre, from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French cueriste, from quer (see choir). The change in the first syllable in the 16th cent. was due to association with obsolete chorist 'member of a choir or chorus', but the older form quirister long survived

entry.def: A chorister is a singer in a church choir.

auth_sentence.content: He became head chorister, then was awarded a music scholarship at Stowe.

auth_sentence.content: Born in Lancashire, the son of a musician, Walton was a chorister and then an undergraduate at Christ Church, Oxford.
